name: Oatmeal with Berries and Flaxseeds
instructions: Combine the oats and almond milk in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Once cooked, top with mixed berries, ground flaxseeds, and a sprinkle of cinnamon. Serve warm for a cholesterol-friendly breakfast.

name: Grilled Salmon with Avocado Salsa
ingredients: 2 salmon fillets (rich in omega-3 fatty acids)
instructions: Preheat the grill to medium heat. Drizzle the salmon fillets with olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and grill for about 4-5 minutes per side until cooked through. For the salsa, mix together diced avocado, red onion, lime juice, and a pinch of salt. Serve the grilled salmon topped with avocado salsa, a heart-healthy dish rich in healthy fats.

name: Chickpea and Spinach Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the chickpeas, spinach, and red onion. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, apple cider vinegar, salt, and pepper. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine. Serve chilled for a refreshing and heart-healthy meal.

name: Roasted Vegetables with Quinoa
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Toss the broccoli and cauliflower florets with olive oil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Roast for 20-25 minutes, or until tender and slightly browned. Serve the roasted vegetables over a bed of cooked quinoa for a fiber-rich, heart-healthy dish.

name: Avocado and Tomato Toast
instructions: Toast the slice of whole grain bread. Spread mashed avocado on the toast and top with sliced cherry tomatoes, fresh basil, and a drizzle of olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper for flavor. This is a simple, heart-healthy snack that helps manage cholesterol levels.

name: Lentil and Veggie Soup
instructions: In a large pot, sauté the onion, garlic, carrot, and celery in a bit of olive oil until softened. Add the lentils, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, turmeric, cumin, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 30 minutes or until the lentils are tender. Serve warm for a heart-healthy, fiber-rich meal.

name: Quinoa and Black Bean Salad
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, black beans, bell pepper, and red onion. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lime juice, cumin, salt, and pepper. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Baked Sweet Potato Fries
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into wedges
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C). Toss the sweet potato wedges with olive oil, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Spread them in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway through, until crispy and tender. Serve as a healthy side dish to complement your meals.

name: Avocado and Cucumber Salad
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine the diced avocado and cucumber. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. Toss gently to combine, then sprinkle with fresh dill, salt, and pepper. Serve chilled for a light, refreshing, and heart-healthy salad.

name: Baked Chickpea Patties
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). In a large bowl, combine the mashed chickpeas, breadcrumbs, olive oil, cumin, paprika, parsley, salt, and pepper. Form the mixture into small patties and place them on a baking sheet. Bake for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden brown. Serve with a side of mixed greens or as a sandwich filling.
